content: By: David Sottimano April 14, 2014 Getting hreflang Right: Examples and Insights for International SEO International SEO If you're trying to figure out exactly what hreflang will and will not do for your sites, this post (complete with examples of hreflang implementations from several major brands) should help set things straight. Read this post By: Sebastian Aroca September 19, 2013 3 Pitfalls to Avoid When Translating a Site to Spanish International SEO Our experience in managing online Hispanic marketing campaigns for clients has taught us that when creating Spanish translations of a site, it is critical that three pitfalls be avoided in order to ensure that this effort is successful. Read this post By: Aleyda Solis September 18, 2013 Using the Correct Hreflang Tag: A New Generator Tool International SEO You may be surprised to know that some large international brands are ranking in the wrong countries, all because they don't correctly use the hreflang annotations. With this new tool, you can be sure you're using the right ones for your international pages. Read this post By: Aleyda Solis August 22, 2013 40+ Tools to Advance Your International SEO Process SEO Tools | International SEO When expanding your web presence to include international audiences, you're faced with a new set of challenges. In this post, MozCon 2013 speaker Aleyda Solis offers 40+ tools to help your marketing reach farther than it ever has before. Read this post By: Aleyda Solis June 26, 2013 The International SEO Checklist International SEO Aleyda shares her International SEO Checklist, with a step-by-step guide to everything from assessing the international SEO potential to targeting an international audience and the development of an internationally targeted site. Dig in! Read this post By: Aleyda Solis March 20, 2013 Discover your International Online Potential International SEO Expanding internationally is one of the advantages of having a web-based business. However, international expansion in our industry tends to be few and far between. In today's post, Aleyda Solis debunks three of the most common misconceptions in having an international web presence. Read this post By: Malcolm Gibb February 21, 2013 Ensuring Your International Domains Don't Cannibalize Your Domestic Rankings International SEO I came in one Monday morning to find the most awful thing an SEO can experience... rankings suddenly switching from .co.uk to international domains across every major generic and brand term in Google UK. This particular client had dominated their own brand and major generic terms in the UK for as long as I can remember and now, somehow their Irish, US (.com) and New Zealand sites were ranking in Google UK, and the .co.uk was nowhere in sight... WTF?! Read this post D By: Daniel Freedman February 15, 2013 Beyond SEO: Why Good Translation is the Secret Sauce for Successful International Projects International SEO These days, product or marketing managers are often given ridiculously short deadlines to do multilingual product launches – everything from websites, to compliance documentation, to manuals, to brochures and marketing materials. And it’s all needed yesterday in a dozen or more languages. International SEO is part of this, but remains just that: part of a larger whole. Read this post By: Zeph Snapp December 6, 2012 So, You Want to Know About Foreign Language SEO? Mozinar Q&A International SEO Last week's Mozinar on foreign language SEO offered stellar advice for localizing and/or translating your site content to reach customers you wouldn't reach otherwise. Today, Zeph Snapp is back to share more tips and answer Q&A from the Mozinar. Read this post By: Gianluca Fiorelli September 27, 2012 International SEO: Dropping the Information Dust International SEO International SEO is on the rise for many reasons not solely related to SEO. Many companies are making expansion in the international market one of their main goals. In this post, I try to solve the possible doubts you may have about this facet of your job as an SEO, explain best practices, give some tips, and explain why companies should invest more of their budget in competing in the foreign arena. Read this post By: Joshua Sturgeon May 31, 2012 Multilingual Domestic SEO: Uncover 'Hidden' Traffic in Your Backyard International SEO You may have already written off multilingual SEO and localization as practices that belong to global brands. "I don't need to worry about other languages", you explain, "our customers all live within the United States!" Read this post C By: Christian Arno April 26, 2012 Secrets of SEO Success in Other Languages International SEO Can you say Google in Chinese? Do you know which social network dwarfs Facebook in Japan? Climbing the search engine rankings can seem a big enough challenge in English, without considering other languages. But optimizing your site for a multilingual audience can reap big rewards, by taking advantage of growing, relatively untapped markets. Read this post By: Tom Anthony December 11, 2011 Tool to Analyze Backlinks for International SEO International SEO This weeks free tool is one that allows you to automatically download a list of backlinks to any URL, broken down not only by TLD/subdomain but also by the language the page is written in (using code from Google's Chrome browser). Great for analysing your own international sites, or as part of your competitor research. Read this post R By: René Reinholdt September 23, 2011 Internationalized Domains and SEO International SEO When it comes to international SEO (especially within EU) there are many questions and myths. One of the myths I have heard most often is that you shouldn't use Special characters in domain names or URLs, since the search engines can't understand them. This is however of cause a false statement. Read this post
